title: Australia bans social media for under-16s | 7NEWS
description: Australia's world-first social media ban for children under 16 takes effect on December 10, requiring platforms like Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, TikTok, and YouTube to block young users or face fines of up to $50 million.   The legislation was driven by grieving mothers Emma Mason and Mia Bannister, whose children died by suicide following social media bullying.   If you need help in a crisis, call Lifeline on 13 11 14. For further information about depression, contact beyondblue on 1300224636 or talk to your GP, local health professional or someone you trust.
